title: JSON Schema for Azure DevOps Extensions

manifestVersion.title: A number corresponding to the version of the manifest format.

id.title: The extension's identifier
id.description: This is a string that must be unique among extensions from the same publisher.

version.title: A string specifying the version of an extension.
version.description: Should be in the format major.minor.patch, for example 0.1.2 or 1.0.0. You can also add a fourth number for the following format: 0.1.2.3

name.title: A short, human-readable name of the extension. Limited to 200 characters.

publisher.title: The identifier of the publisher.
publisher.description: This identifier must match the identifier the extension is published under.
publisher.$comment: This identifier must match the identifier the extension is published under.

categories.title: Array of strings representing the categories your extension belongs to.
categories.description: At least one category must be provided and there is no limit to how many categories you may include.

targets.title: The products and services supported by your integration or extension.

id.title: Installation targets: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/extend/develop/manifest?view=azure-devops#installation-targets
id.description: Id of the product or service which your integration/extension should support

version.title: Installation target versions: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/extend/develop/manifest?view=azure-devops#installation-targets
version.description: Some installation target identifiers, like and , support an optional version range. This further clarifies the supported releases the extension or integration is supported on.Microsoft.TeamFoundation.ServerMicrosoft.TeamFoundation.Server.Integration
version.$comment: Some installation target identifiers, like and , support an optional version range. This further clarifies the supported releases the extension or integration is supported on.Microsoft.TeamFoundation.ServerMicrosoft.TeamFoundation.Server.Integration

scopes.title: Authorization scopes required by your extension.
scopes.description: An array of authorization scopes (strings) listing permissions required by your extension.

demands.title: Capabilities required by your extension.
demands.description: An array of demands (strings) listing the capabilities required by your extension.

baseUri.description: (Optional) base URL for all relative URLs specified by the extension's contributions.
baseUri.title: This property should be left empty if your extension's contents are packaged with your extension.

description.title: A few sentences describing the extension.

icons.description: Dictionary of icons representing the extension.

default.title: (128x128 pixels) of type BMP, GIF, EXIF, JPG, PNG and TIFF.
default.description: The value must be the path to the icon file in the extension

tags.description: Array of string tags to help users find your extension.

items.description: A tag to help users find your extension.

galleryFlags.description: Array of string tags to classify your extension within the Visual Studio Marketplace

items.description: A string tag to classify your extension within the Visual Studio Marketplace

screenshots.title: Screenshots are more valuable when featured in your content, and should be used there to help make a quality market details page for your extension. Use screenshots for less important images not featured in your content.
screenshots.description: Array of images that could not be included in your **content*.

items.title: An image that could not be included in your **content*.

path.title: Each image should be 1366x768 pixels.
path.description: The path of each item is the path to the file in the extension.

content.title: Dictionary of content files that describe your extension to users.

details.title: Extension Details (GitHub Flavored Markdown File)
details.description: GitHub Flavored Markdown file which describes the details of the Extension

license.title: Extension License Information (GitHub Flavored Markdown File)
license.description: GitHub Flavored Markdown file which describes the license information of the Extension

pricing.title: Extension Pricing Information (GitHub Flavored Markdown File)
pricing.description: GitHub Flavored Markdown file which describes the pricing information of the Extension

links.title: Dictionary of links that help users learn more about your extension, get support, and move.

getstarted.title: Get Started Documentation (GitHub Flavored Markdown File)
getstarted.description: First steps, how to setup or use.

learn.title: Learning Documentation (GitHub Flavored Markdown File)
learn.description: Deeper content to help users better understand your extension or service.

support.title: Support Information (GitHub Flavored Markdown File)
support.description: Get help and support for an extension.

repository.title: The source code repository for the extension

badges.description: Array of links to external metadata badges like TravisCI, Appveyor etc from the approved badges sites.
badges.title: Approved Badge Sites: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/extend/develop/manifest.#approvedbadges

href.description: Link the user navigates to when clicking the badge.

uri.description: The absolute URL of the badge image to be displayed.

description.title: Description of the badge, to be displayed on hover.

color.description: Primary color of the extension or publisher; can be a hex (#ff00ff), RGB (rgb(100,200,50)), or supported HTML color names (blue).

theme.description: Complements the color; use dark for dark branding colors, or light for lighter branding colors.

public.description: Set to true to make this extension public in the Visual Studio Market Place

files.title: The files section is where you reference any files you wish to include in your extension. You can add both folders and individual files.

items.description: A file you wish to include in your extension. Both folders and individual files are acceptable

path.description: Path of resource, root directory is where your manifest file is located

addressable.description: Set to true if you want your file to be URL-addressable

packagePath.description: Places your resource from disk to the specified value when packaged

contributions.title: An array of contributions to the system.

contributionTypes.title: An array of contribution types defined by the extension
